name: Premier Inn London County Hall

reviews.text: We just checked in this morning and fell in love with this hotel already! Nelcy and Oksana are so helpful checking us in earlier after seeing my 2 sleeping and tired kids. Really appreciate that! And our family room is just huge! Can't beat the location, London Eye is next door, Big Ben is minutes away and the view is gorgeous if you just walk a bit to the river! Only complain is there is no free wifi...
reviews.title: A great choice in deed!

reviews.text: The ubiquitous Premier offering feels well at home in this landmark building: clean, well used and well maintained, comfortable and unintimidating. Our twin room (419) was spacious with two double beds (£139 inc. breakfast). Fittings totally standardised. No unpleasant surprises. Silence. Breakfast was busy but efficient and pleasant. Staff (check-in, breakfast and chamber-maids) were well drilled and motivated. All spoke English (and other languages). Parking (why do we need a car in central London - it's a long story; we were there for a wedding) is remarkably easy: you approach the hotel front door via a button/barrier; after checking in you are directed to local undercover parking (£20 for 24 hours) a couple of minutes walk away. For reliable convenient value in central London this hotel must be hard to beat: but if you want to spend a lot more elsewhere for all the trimmings, feel free.
reviews.title: A genuine good deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Absolutely superb, Staff very friendly,and rooms of a good standard
reviews.title: First Rate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel's location is ideal for sightseeing and traveling.
reviews.title: The best location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean, excellent service, no hidden nasties.
reviews.title: They're a Premier Inn for a reason!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife said this was a well oiled operation. I agree the staff were brilliant very welcoming and friendly. We had bed and breakfast and the food was brill it was an all you can eat very fresh fruit, juices, yogurts and cooked breakfast. The tastiest sausages ever. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable with excellent pillows. It was very hot outside with no air con but there were fans provided and the room was very cool.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: From Sweden with three kids, 1, 11 and 13 yrs. The room was nice, comfortable and clean. Good location for us, the kids enjoyed that it was in the middle of everything.
reviews.title: Family of five

reviews.text: Extra plus for the very friendly staff who actually seemed to like that we came with three kids in different ages.
reviews.title: Excellent location; friendly and efficient staff; good value.

reviews.text: We stayed for five very HOT days though, and the airconditioning didn´t really work, an extra fan was in the room, but still a bit too hot, got worse during the stay.
reviews.title: Terrific location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were still satisfied, nothing fancy, burt good value for money! Could choose it again.
reviews.title: fantastic location

reviews.text: I picked this hotel because (i) I wanted to be near the Royal Festival Hall for an evening concert, and (ii) I was under the impression (according to the hotel's advertisement and some comments on this forum) that the hotel has reliable wi-fi.
reviews.title: Good location, yes, but there are problems

reviews.text: As it turned out, the location was the best thing about this hotel. It is indeed but a short walk to the Royal Festival Hall and the rest of the South Bank Centre, as well as all the tourist attractions just across the Thames: Big Ben, Westminister Abbey, the Trafalgar Square, etc.
reviews.title: Excellent location
Awesome location!
reviews.text: But that comes at a price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The South Bank Centre is a big carnival in perpetual motion. It is teeming with hawkers and gawkers all day. So every time you walk on the river-side path, you have to dodge the crowd and endure the sights of impersonators of the Queen, the pirate of Carribean, the axe murderer, etc. For me, it got old really fast. The subway stations are within walking distance, but to get to the Embankment station (the one I prefer), you have to walk up a steep flight of steps and then across a bridge - although it must be said that the view from the bridge is great.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic Location and Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are other more tangible problems.
reviews.title: Just above average

reviews.text: We had travelled from Norfolk for an overnight stay as we had tickets for The Railway Children at Waterloo Station theatre. This was a perfect location (2 minute walk), particularly as we were going to the evening performance which meant a late night for our 8 year old. We haven't stayed in a PI before and previously have stayed in the Park Plaza just down the road from here, which is also great, but on this occasion we didn't want to pay their higher prices simply to have a bed for the night. The facilities were clean and comfortable for our requirements and the staff were helpful and friendly - and actually smiled!! Didn't try the breakfast as we went to the restaturant (Cucina) directly opposite the hotel entrance, which we discovered on a previous visit and can definitely recommend it - they do every possible combination of cooked breakfast at a very reasonable price (approx £6.50). If we needed somewhere to rest our heads for a night in London then this is a great place to stay and good value and we would definitely stay here again. However, if coming for a longer trip and wanted somewhere a bit more special but still family friendly then I'd opt for the Park Plaza (their studio rooms are great for families) just at the other end of the road (there are two - Addington Street and Westminster Bridge - both right next to each other) - and would go to Cucina for breakfast wherever I was staying!
reviews.title: Ideal for good value short stay with children

reviews.text: We just got back from a Xmas break at PI County Hall. Staff fab except poor bus info, rooms good but had a broken door handle and safe did not work for 24hrs. That said can not fault anything else. Price, service, breakfast and location amazing. We will be back. Good job!!
reviews.title: Very good, but the odd fault.

reviews.text: We stayed for a couple of nights with our children just before Christmas. We wanted a good base from which we could be in easy reach of the main shopping areas and main local attractions.
reviews.title: Great location and great hotel - can't fault it

reviews.text: This hotel is perfectly located, right on the river Thames next to the London Eye and next to Westminster bridge with a gorgeous view of Big Ben, my favourite London landmark.
reviews.title: Stay after long haul flight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At Christmas time it's a great spot because there's a Christmas market next to the London Eye and it's a short walk to Somerset House where we went ice skating. We also went to see Slava's Snowshow at the Royal Festival Hall, pretty much right next to the hotel.
reviews.title: great hotel, close to attractions and waterloo station

reviews.text: I stopped here with my husband and child during Christmas week. It is centered behind the London eye in Westminster. The room was clean and spacious - no complaints. Breakfast was a buffet and was lovely. I would definately stop here again.
reviews.title: Very good service & clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have just had the best 3 days away in London thanks to the Premier Inn, County Hall. This was choosen for the location, easy reach for the attractions London has to offer. Every where with in easy walking distance and that includes the museums in Knightsbridge. The rooms were veery quiet and comfortable. The breakfast was buffet style which for me is a blessing, as I could chose what I wanted and how much I wanted.
reviews.title: OC from Wiltshire

reviews.text: We have just come home from a 4 day stay at County Hall. It was a thoroughly enjoyable experience for us. We travelled as a family including one 5 year old & one teenager. The hotel was chosen mainly because of it:s position - right next door to the Eye & within easy reach of all the "touristy" places. Waterloo tube station was minutes away. Use Westminster tube station though, as the short walk accross the bridge was worth it just for the photo opportunties.
reviews.title: First Class

reviews.text: Self check-in was something new but we were guided through this by a very friendly & helpful member of staff. Our room was spacious & was in first class order. Very clean & in excellent decorative order - as was everywhere we saw. The bathroom was was very clean & looked as if it was brand new.
reviews.title: the best location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was great, especially when kids eat for free. The range & quality of the food was excellent. On a couple of nights we ate in the restaurant as it was such good value. We never felt rushed & were served by great staff who had time & patience with our children. Alexandra was a joy to talk to.
reviews.title: Good base

reviews.text: I stayed with my friend for two nights, checking out today. The hotel is in an excellent location very close to Waterloo train station/underground. Quite a few bars and restaurants nearby as well as right opposite the London Eye and river. It's also an excellent place to stay if you have family or friends in St Thomas' Hospital which is right across the road. It would make visiting so easy. We stayed in room 327 which was massive. I thought we were missing a set of towels and phoned reception and received two sets within 10 minutes. We did have them already I just hadn't realised. Great customer service.
reviews.title: Great Location and Room

reviews.text: Breakfast was excellent, quite busy but it is a big hotel. Lots of choice, I never eat a cooked breakfast but enjoyed some scrambled eggs with vegetarian sausage. Very tasty indeed. The gentleman who welcomes you at breakfast and shows you to your table is a real asset to the company. He is very polite.
reviews.title: Good value hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was really hot the past few days and the only downside of this hotel is that it isn't allowed air-conditioning in the rooms so I was told, as its a listed building. There is air conditioning in the rest of the hotel. We had a fan in our room but to be honest I was absolutely far too hot to sleep well. That was the only downside. I would however stay there again as the price is reasonable. The room was very quiet. We had our window open as well to try and get some air going though the room and was not disturbed by the outside noise.
reviews.title: Very good location and friendly hard working staff

reviews.text: All staff that I came across were polite and possessed great customer care service. All in all one of the best Premier Inns I have stayed in and will return.
reviews.title: Fantastic position

reviews.text: Great location. Good breakfast. Basic clean room. But only 30 min of free WiFi.
reviews.title: Convenient, clean and sensibly priced (for London!)

reviews.text: Typicall Premier Inn in a great location.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Not he best in the chain but the location is second to none. Quite busy with tourists but the room itsel was quiet and I managed to get a good nights sleep.
reviews.title: favorite place to stay in London

reviews.text: The location of this hotel is superb, this is a fairly basic/no frills good value hotel in the center
reviews.title: Mediorce

reviews.text: of London. We have stayed here 3 or 4 times over the years and are never disappointed.
reviews.title: Great location. . . .

reviews.text: The most recent noticeable difference is the staff actually appear to be extremely well trained and go out of their way to make their visitors feel welcome. Not they were bad before - but as Brits living in America we are just used to better customer service in the USA so it was a great surprise to us to be treated in such a first class manner when we stayed a couple of weeks ago.
reviews.title: Clean, friendly and great location

reviews.text: I haven't stayed here for a while and had forgotten just how good the location is. Central for the London Eye, Westminster Abbey, Houses of Parliament, Southbank Centre and the river. A short walk up to Trafalgar Square, Leicester Square, Chinatown etc. We hardly used the tube at all during our stay.
reviews.title: Best location in town

reviews.text: The automated check-in is a little souless but there were odd staff members milling around who helped put our case away for us as we were too early to check-in. The room is what you expect of a Premier Inn - compact, relatively modern, clean and fit for purpose. The bathroom was rather small but about what I would expect for central London.
reviews.title: great for families

reviews.text: Our room was really cold when we arrived but once we realised that somebody had turned the radiator off at the wall, we soon sorted this out.
reviews.title: Disappointing / On this ocassion let the brand down.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The big downside to this hotel is that you can never get in. Their policy of allowing cancellations until 1pm on the day of booking means that so many people book speculatively and then cancel that when you are trying to plan a trip, it always appears fully booked.
reviews.title: convenient and clean

reviews.text: well located, clean, everything you would hope for for a good night's sleep. stayed for two nights with 2 children and was pleasantly surprised how comfortable additional beds were. breakfast was plentiful and hot - an excellent start to sightseeing. good value.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Premier Inn - couldn't fault it

aka: Premier Inn London County Hall Hotel London
